title: Exxon aims to triple Permian shale output over next seven years
text:
January 30, 2018 / 4:08 PM / Updated 7 minutes ago Exxon aims to triple Permian shale output over next seven years Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
HOUSTON, Jan 30 (Reuters) - Exxon Mobil Corp said on Tuesday it plans to triple its oil and natural production in the Permian Basin of West Texas and New Mexico by 2025 and spend $2 billion there to expand a crude storage terminal. 
The worldâ€™s largest publicly-traded oil producer said it expects to pump more than 600,000 barrels of oil equivalent per day (boe/d) from the Permian within seven years by boosting output from both traditional and shale wells. Exxon said its shale acreage alone should see a five-fold output increase over that time frame. (Reporting by Ernest Scheyder)
